Leaders of international Gen Z movement reflect on their countries' political futures
subhead: From Nepal to Madagascar and Peru, youth-led revolts driven by socio-economic demands have shaken governments. But their horizontal mobilization strategy, born of digital culture, now hampers the political outcomes of these movements.

COP30: 'Those drawn to China's environmental push should keep a few facts in mind'
BBC apologizes to Trump, rejects defamation claim
subhead: The British broadcaster's chair sent a letter to the White House to make it clear that 'he and the corporation are sorry for the edit of the president's speech,' in reference to a documentary aired last year that implied the US president had directly urged 'violent action' before the assault on the Capitol.

headline: Kyiv is under 'massive' attack, says mayor
subhead: Russia has intensified its attacks on Ukrainian energy facilities and rail systems. Early on Friday morning, almost every district in Kyiv was under 'massive' attack, with explosions reported in the city center.

headline: Uyghurs are no longer welcome in Turkey
subhead: As Turkey strengthens ties with China, the Turkish government has shifted its migration policy toward members of the Muslim minority from Xinjiang, a community it historically protected. Expulsions of Uyghurs are on the rise, as revealed by a Human Rights Watch investigation.

headline: The relentless spiral of speed watching: 'If I don't set it to at least 1.5×, I get bored'
subhead: From TikTok to YouTube, more and more young people are watching videos at increased speeds to consume more content in less time.

'Delhi is no longer livable': Deadly pollution in Indian capital claims more than 17,000 lives each year
subhead: Millions of firecrackers set off during the Hindu festival of Diwali at the end of October have worsened the already extreme fine particle pollution engulfing the megacity. Every winter, Delhi's 30 million residents face a toxic nightmare, while blistering heat waves strike the city each summer.

headline: How the Paris attacks of November 13, 2015, unfolded, minute-by-minute
subhead: Le Monde has gathered exclusive first-hand testimonies and created a 3D Bataclan reconstruction to revisit the night that changed France, 10 years ago.

headline: L'Arrêt by The Grey, an American bistro in Paris
subhead: Mashama Bailey, a renowned figure in Southern US cuisine, has just opened a new restaurant in Paris. There, cornbread, Country Captain chicken and Savannah Red Rice are reinvented using French ingredients.
